title: extremely slow score/predict methods for sktime.classifier APIs
body:
**Describe the bug**

Slow (several minutes, without completion) computation when trying to predict or score time-series classifiers with `sktime.classification` APIs. Issue is not resolved even if the label dtype is modified (to object, float, int, etc.) even though example seems to use str type for labels (see input [4] [here](https://www.sktime.org/en/latest/examples/02_classification_univariate.html)).

**To Reproduce**
See code snippet below, with simulated data. 

```python
import numpy as np
from sktime.utils.data_processing import from_2d_array_to_nested
from sktime.classification.distance_based import KNeighborsTimeSeriesClassifier

# simulate data as sinusoid for 1000 samples, add white noise
t = np.linspace(0, 2*3.14, 2048)
x = np.repeat(np.sin(t).reshape(-1, 1), 1000, axis=1).T
x += np.random.uniform(0, 1, size=x.shape)

# convert to sktime data rep
X_train = from_2d_array_to_nested(x)

# init and fit model
clf = KNeighborsTimeSeriesClassifier()
dummy_binary = np.array(np.random.choice([0, 1], X_train.shape[0]), dtype=str)
clf.fit(X_train, dummy_binary)

# eval
clf.score(X_train, dummy_binary) # SLOW, does not complete computation
# clf.predict(X_train) # same problem as above
```

**Expected behavior**
The classifier fits in ms, and I expect the scoring/predict methods to be fast as well.

**Additional context**
Trying to do a multi-class classification problem with 1D time-series and ran into this bug while trying to get baselines using several classifiers from sktime. I thought it was an sklearn issue (perhaps related to [issue#10802](https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/10802)); however, when interrupted, the `clf.score(...)` method is stuck inside some `sktime` script after calling `clf.predict`, e.g., see tiny error snippets below for the cBOSS classifier:
